alert.note: Alert for Doddridge; Harrison; Pleasants; Ritchie; Tyler (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 1:46AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Heavy rain and thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Washington, eastern Pleasants, eastern Ritchie, Doddridge, Tyler and northern Harrison Counties through 215 AM EDT... At 146 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking heavy rain and thunderstorms along a line extending from near Sistersville to near Harrisville. Movement was northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Clarksburg, Harrisville, St. Marys, Middlebourne, Bridgeport, Paden City, Shinnston, Nutter Fort, Salem, Sistersville, Pennsboro, Lumberport, West Union, Enterprise, Matamoras, Ellenboro, Pullman, Friendly, Fly and Grangeville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 120 and 128. Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 34 and 80. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
